100.heading: Moda.
100.title: "Den II"
100.author: by Richard Corben
100.appears_in: p. 21-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 1 (Apr. 1982).
notes: "When we last saw Tarn and Moda, they were in the presence of Jord, the leader of the Muvovum people. He was accompanied by his pet, Jordella, who took an instant liking to Moda. Unfortunately, the feelings weren't mutual, and Moda threw Jordella to the ground. With that, the guards carried him off. The rest remains to be seen."
"To be continued."

108.heading: Modan, Rutu.
108.title: Exit Wounds
108.author: Rutu Modan ; translation by Noah Stollman.
notes: Summary (from OCLC): Set in modern-day Tel Aviv, a young man, Koby Franco, receives an urgent phone call from a female soldier. Learning that his estranged father may have been a victim of a suicide bombing in Hadera, Koby reluctantly joins the soldier in searching for clues. His death would certainly explain his empty apartment and disconnected phone line. As Koby tries to unravel the mystery of his father's death, he finds himself piecing together not only the last few months of his father's life but his entire identity.

151.heading: Model Airplanes.
151.title: "The Movie Camera"
151.author: [No author]
151.series: Li'l Eight Ball) 6 p. in New Funnies, no. 102
notes: Summary: Eight Ball wants to impress Honeysuckle Jones, and builds a flying model airplane. She puts on a new hat to impress him, but the airplane destroys the hat and she gives him a good beating. Then Mammy sends Eight Ball to watch the store (the Dixieland Newsreel and Snapshot Co. Inc.) while Uncle Washboard has his lunch. A running gun battle goes by in the street, and Eight Ball catches it on Uncle Washboard's movie camera. The crooks are caught and Eight Ball gets a reward, which impresses Honesuckle Jones, and he invites her over for a screen test.

168.heading: Model King of Magadha.
168.title: "Bimbisara : Model King of Magadha"
168.author: script, H
168.appears_in: Atmaram ; illustrations, Ram Waeerkar ; editor, Anant Pai. p. 1-30 in Amar Chitra Katha, no. 688 (1983, 2009 printing).
notes: (Bravehearts)

Summary from back cover: "Dutiful son, doting father, capable general, wise ruler: Bimbisara had earned the right to grow old in peace; but his son had other plans for him. Through his darkest hours Bimbisara was sustained by the gentle teachings of his royal-born friend Gautama Buddha, who had renounced his own kingdom of Magadha around present-day Bihar. We get a glimpse of the life and times of this great king, who lived nearly 2500 years ago, in the Buddhist and Jain literature of the period."

notes: NOTES: David Knight, son of original Starman, challenges Payton.
Data from Jon Ingersoll of Grand Comics Database.

246.heading: Models.
246.title: "Now Who's the Before Model?"
246.author: by Darby Conley.
notes: Summary: Bucky has an interesting bump on his head, and Satchel suggests he could be the "ugly person in a before-and-after picture." Bucky takes exception.

247.heading: Models.
247.title: "Osteosaurus Bone"
247.author: J Sayers.
notes: Summary: The bone becomes part of a model in the museum.

249.heading: Models.
249.title: "Perfect Model"
249.author: Beppe Sabatini, writer ; Gray Morrow, artist & writer ; Ron Courtney, colorist
notes: SUMMARY: A boy makes the perfect girl from a hobby kit.

250.heading: Models.
250.title: "Pick Out Any Model You Want, Son!"
250.author: Henry Boltinoff
250.appears_in: 1/2 p. in Mystery in Space, no. 107 (May 1966).
notes: Advertising strip.
Data from Mike Tiefenbacher, Bob Hughes, Clayton Emery, et al. via Grand Comics Database.

251.heading: Models.
251.title: "Pickman's Model"
251.author: Arnold
notes: (Lovecraft special issue)
Drawn by Herb Arnold, cf. Kennedy, Jay. The Official Underground and Newave Comix Price Guide.

252.heading: Models.
252.title: "Rene Maran"
252.author: by J
252.appears_in: A. Rogers ; illustrated by Samuel Milai.
notes: Divided panel with items on writer Rene Maran, on the first settler in the city of Chicago, Baptiste Pointe du Saible, and on the "splendid physiques" of Black people being used as models by Greek sculptors.
From microfilm of the Pittsburgh Courier.
"Copyright 1934" appears in the logo, but does not date the individual appearances of this feature.

253.heading: Models.
253.title: "Ship Models You Can Make" p. 34-37 in True Comics, no. 14
253.author: [No author]

254.title: "A Simple Model"
254.author: by Garcés

255.heading: Models.
255.title: "A Statue of Liberty out of Toothpicks?"
255.author: Amend.
notes: Summary: Jason is being creative, and even "sort of All-American and wholesome," until you notice the little terrorists with A-bombs on his model statue.

256.heading: Models.
256.title: "Supermodel Olive Oyl"
256.author: Jim Berry.
notes: Summary: Olive follows another thin model on the runway.

257.heading: Models.
257.title: "TV or Not TV"
257.author: Stan Lee
257.appears_in: 4 p. in A Date with Millie, no. 7 (Oct. 1960).
notes: Begins: Are you interested in this model, Mr. Jones?

258.heading: Models.
258.title: "There Isn't a Rose That's Born Without a Thorn"
258.author: Alfred James, Mel Casson.
notes: Summary: Dilly describes her life as a model in a letter to her mom.

259.heading: Models.
259.title: "This is Art" p. 52-56 in Bitch in Heat. vol. 1
259.author: by Giovanna Casotto (Seattle, WA : Eros Comix, 1998).
notes: Summary: A model poses for a pornographic painting, first in her fantasies and then in reality, and the two experiences are similar.

260.heading: Models.
260.title: "This Particular Model has the Tina Turner Mimic Option"
260.author: Russell Myers.
notes: Summary: Broom-Hilda demonstrates her new personal robot.

261.heading: Models.
261.title: "The Undertaker's Model"
261.author: art by Luis Garcia ; story by Jack L

263.heading: Models.
263.title: "Watch Out for Hot Flashes"
263.author: art by Liberatore ; written by G
263.appears_in: Setbon. p. 51-59 in Video Clips (New York : Catalan Communicatons, 1985)
notes: Summary: Hot model Virginia Rozaki summons photographer David Tybalt and a corps of other photographers for a free photo session. An old Arab has told her that every picture taken of her shortens her life by a year, so she kills the photographers one by one in revenge.

264.heading: Models.
264.title: "Where do they Plug her in?"
264.author: by Jay Martin.
notes: Summary: Gina keeps her room so clean it's insane, she must be a Stepford model.

notes: About model and artist Suzanne Valadon.
